title: Rock Creek Park: Laws & Policies
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Management     Laws & Policies               Laws & Policies      FirearmsAs of February 22, 2010, a new federal law makes possession of firearms in national parks subject to local and state firearms laws. It is the responsibility of visitors to understand and comply with all applicable state, local, and federal firearms laws before entering this park. As a starting point, please visit the District of Columbiaâ€™s website.District of Columbia LawSee Division I, Title 7, Subtitle J, Chapter 25See also Division IV, Title 22, Subtitle VI, Chapter 45District of Columbia Attorney GeneralFederal law continues to prohibit firearms in federal facilities in this park.  Those federal facilities are marked with signs at public entrances. Thus firearms are prohibited at Carter Barron Amphitheater and Box Office, Center for Urban Ecology, Georgetown Waterfront Office, Klingle Mansion and Outer Buildings 1&2, Meridian Hill Lodge House, Nebraska House Park Housing 1&2, Old Stone House, Peirce Mill Barn, Rock Creek Maintenance Facility, Rock Creek Nature Center.United States Park Police District 3 Facilities
